title: 107_hr4940
content: The Act may be cited as the "Arlington National Cemetery Burial Eligibility Act" and specifies persons eligible for burial in Arlington National Cemetery. The "Arlington National Cemetery Burial Eligibility Act" amends Chapter 24 of title 38, United States Code, to specify individuals eligible for burial at Arlington National Cemetery, including members of the Armed Forces who die on active duty, retired members, and certain former reserve component members. Any former member of the Armed Forces separated for physical disability before October 1, 1949, who served on active duty and would have been eligible for retirement under the provisions of section 1201 of title 10. Any former member of the Armed Forces whose last active duty military service terminated honorably and who has been awarded specific decorations. The Arlington National Cemetery allows for the burial of various individuals, including former prisoners of war, members of the reserve component who die in the line of duty, and Presidents. Family members such as spouses, minor children, and unmarried adult children can also be buried in the same gravesite as the eligible individual. The Arlington National Cemetery allows for the burial of spouses, minor children, and unmarried adult children of members of the Armed Forces on active duty. Parents of eligible individuals can also be buried in the same gravesite as their child. The Arlington National Cemetery allows for the burial of spouses, minor children, and unmarried adult children of members of the Armed Forces on active duty. Additionally, parents of eligible individuals can also be buried in the same gravesite as their child. Eligibility for burial is subject to certain conditions, including the absence of a memorial in a national cemetery. The Arlington National Cemetery allows for the burial of spouses, minor children, and unmarried adult children of members of the Armed Forces on active duty. In the case of an unmarried adult child who is incapable of self-support due to a physical or mental condition, they may be buried without approval if in the same gravesite as the eligible parent. Family members of persons buried in a group gravesite are not eligible for burial in the same site. The President has the exclusive authority to deem individuals not otherwise eligible for burial in Arlington National Cemetery eligible if their acts, service, or contributions to the Armed Forces are extraordinary. This authority cannot be delegated except in specific circumstances. Section 2413 of title 38, United States Code, allows for the placement of cremated remains in the columbarium at Arlington National Cemetery for certain individuals, including veterans with honorable service and their eligible family members. Section 2414 of title 38, United States Code, authorizes headstones, markers, and monuments at Arlington National Cemetery. Regulations ensure that these markers are simple, dignified, and suitable for a military cemetery.
